byline.contributor: John Markoff reported from San Francisco and Paul Mozur from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By JOHN MARKOFF and PAUL MOZUR

abstract: Artificial-intelligence software known as Xiaoice has rapidly become popular in China, where its ability to mimic human conversation provides comfort to many; interface, developed by Microsoft, represents both culmination of years of artificial intelligence research and direction it will take in future.
lead_paragraph: A new Microsoft chatbot called Xiaoice has become something of a hit in China, with responses based on actual conversations culled from the Internet.

headline.main: For Sympathetic Ear, More Chinese Turn to Smartphone Program
headline.print_headline: Program Knows Just How You Feel
